channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple bin bags on the green, 12th August
item.description:
Put there by a resident on Ravensworth Road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravensworth Road, Elmstead, London

item.title: Fly tipping on street, 12th August
item.description:
Batwa house constantly puts their rubbish on the street and their bins are over-flowing. They have now piled rubbish, wood and cardboard boxes on the street. This attracts foxes and rats and is unacceptable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Varcoe Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Repeated noise and exhaust pollution from classic car on Stoke Newington Church Street, 12th August
item.description:
A red classic Ford Mustang regularly parks on the West side of Church Street. Multiple times a week, the engine is revved excessively, creating very high noise levels and the exhaust produces a strong smell of unburnt petrol, which drifts into my flat.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large number of bin bags piled in the car park behind the high street for months., 12th August
item.description:
The large pile of black bin bags piled up in the car park at the junction between The Drive and the Beckenham High Street (Next to the cafe shop) for months. With temperature rising, the smell is unbearable and it attacks large number of flies and rats during the day and night . There seems no incentive of having the rubbish removed from the premise. One can catch the horrible smell from the high street and from The Drive . It was horrible .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Terribly uneven walkway., 12th August
item.description:
The length of the walkway all along Bethune rd (asphalted side) is hideously uneven. Several parts have been dug up and unevenly filled. Riding along this lengthy stretch of pavement on the mobility scooter, at moderate speed, is like riding over rocks.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Berry tree growing out of allotment, 12th August
item.description:
There is a berry tree growing out of an allotment near Gannet House, Pelican Estates. There are alot of bushes which are getting out of hand but this particular one is growing berries which are dropping on the floor and ending up sticking to footwear and leaving a mess in the property. It woould be helpful if this can be maintained or cut down as it is also creating a mess right outside my doorstep.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Talfourd Road, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Action Needed on Waste Accumulation and Rodent Infestation, 12th August
item.description:
In March, a report was submitted about the growing waste issue on Mandela Way opposite to Tesco petrol station. Unfortunately, the problem has not been addressed and has worsened over time. The waste continues to accumulate, creating an unsightly and unsanitary environment. More concerning, the area is now attracting rats, which poses a significant public health risk. Immediate action is needed to clean up the waste and tackle the rodent problem. This situation requires urgent attention to protect the health and safety of the community.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mandela Way, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left behind, 12th August
item.description:
There are carton boxes left behind even though were taken out on time. The other bin bags were picked up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, D'Arblay Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bermondsey Bar And Kitchen Bin Waste has made the pavement/street a health hazard, 12th August
item.description:
Bermondsey Bar and Kitchen roll their bins onto the pavement and road. Both the road and pavement are now thick with black, sticky waste which is a health hazard. People cross over the road to avoid it now. Please insist they clean their mess up or pay a firm to do so. Jet washing for example.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Snowsfields, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nazi symbol, 12th August
item.description:
The new signs in hornfair park have graffiti on them placed by those at the height of intelligence in our society. This one has a swastika the other near Inigo Jones Road has a cock and balls.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince Henry Road, Charlton, London
